Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Thriftsav
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Good- front desk was very helpful, cheap and close to most things. Bad- room was tiny Beds super uncomfortable No air con (and hotel is about 5deg hotter than outside) Fan noisy and inefficient Noisy (sounds of hotel machinery) Tv small and 15 years old no sitting space Very hard to get a good nights sleep here. Will not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst!”
Reviews.Author: vermilion777
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel recently - noisy floorboards, found the staff very rude for my liking. When I checked in and tried to pay by eftpos - I had walked all the way from Central Station to the hotel and was made to walk back to my ATM atleast 3 times due to lack of communication from the gentleman who failed to advise me on thefirst go that if one is paying by EFTPOS for the room then the $100 SECURITY BOND we are made to payo n top of this has to be paid in CASH ONLY! Poor communcation skills of the staff and grumpy housekepeing staff as well make this a place to visi only once. Also no AIRCONDITIONING IN THE ROOMS and it gets very hot! The fan in the room was hopeless and did not do much to stifle the heat. NEVER WORTH GOING THERE AGAIN! Foreigners and locals must avoid this place at all costs due to the rude staff....not worth the stress!

Reviews.Title: “If You don't mind the cockroaches!!!”
Reviews.Author: etarmo
Reviews.Content: I mean there were these bugs, and not so few ... I had to eliminate some the moment we stepped in. Although all other aspects regarding this hotel were okay, it really ruins Your relaxation time at the hotel if You have to think about cockroaches sneaking around. For 139 dollars such a doghole - it is a robbery - as far as I am concerned. So what we did, we took a car the next morning, added some money and took a place out of town (Novotel at Rooty Hill), where You can have with 177 dollars a really modern, spacious, high class room! My strong advise - book Central on Wentworth only in case if You have no other option. Or, if You don't mind the bugs ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a budget get away”
Reviews.Author: alanna1622
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok for a cheap long weekend. I stayed in a twin share which was located on the 4th floor. The elevator was so slow I challenged to beat my friend up via the stairs. We both arrived at the 4th floor from ground at the same time, with out me running. I then dreaded using the elevator knowing I could walk just as fast. Our room was neat and tidy. Just big enough for two people and luggage. There was no remote for the tv or air con so they were both either on or off. There was no phone. The bathroom was the smallest I've seen in a hotel. Every time I was in there I was sure to bump an elbow. But in saying that, it was still a bathroom everything worked fine. The hotel only gave us one key, I ask for another one and they said they could hand us another one that couldn't leave the hotel if one of us came back on our own. Neither of us had to use this option but it was good to know it was there. There was a vending machine on the ground floor as well as a computer with free internet access. On the first floor had the kitchen, eating area, laundry and shared rooms with the shared bathrooms and toilets. Even though I didn't use any of these rooms I have taken pictures to share. Central station was only a short distance away. You can pretty much get a train to anywhere from there. Along the way there was restaurants and lots of places to buy food. Darling harbor and china town was only a short walk away. If you can't sleep with noise the trains are the only thing that woke me up when they started running around 5-6am

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced for what it is but good location”
Reviews.Author: redmouserag
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the christmas and new year season so the already inflated price for this 2star hotel was even more over the top. Front of house staff are very unfriendly and can be quite rude. The room was ok, quite small but nice bathroom. I.e. not dirty. Please note there is no WiFi, you have to pay from $4 for an hours useage through to $35 for a week, however, the internet allowance is a disgrace and is in very small print beneath the prices. We purchased the weeks worth of internet so we could Skype our family over the festive period and it lasted a mere 10 minutes as we later found out you are only allocated 450mb worth of data. The manager more or less shrugged his shoulders after complaining, the whole thing was very underhand and misleading and it only highlighted the utter lack of value for money this place really is.

Reviews.Title: “Wentworth hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: YootC
Reviews.Content: The location is within walking distance to Sydney's main attraction, train station and buses. Bus 555 free bus is an added bonus. We had the use of the free internet for 10mins each log-on. The reception is open 24 hours. Staff very obliging, friendly and courteous. The elevator was a great help to transport the luggage to the third floor. The room very basic. We had the use of the fridge, tea/coffee making facilities. Air condition noisy. The knob to turn the electric fan was missing. This was reported but nothing was done. I was given a pair of pliers to turn the dial!! The shower head did not operate properly....the water sprayed in all different directions, not where you want it to. I killed a cockroach in the bathroom. I reported this and was told 'this is Australia'. Reception did come and sprayed the window sill. Later I discovered a dead cockroach down the stairs which was lying there for a few days. Very off putting. It was useful to have laundry facilities. The communal kitchen was quite 'rough' and I hesitated to use it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Jedika13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was neat. The elevator was a great help with heavy luggage. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and you could tell were attended to daily. The kitchen was a little gross; there were a few bugs, but cooking utensils were readily available. The people there were interesting. The 555 bus (which is free!) is half a second around the corner and takes you to most ofthe interesting parts if sydney such as town hall, QVB and circular quay. The location of the hotel is ideal for public transport, shopping, some foods and the CBD. Overall, I would recommend if, especially like me, you are on a small budget.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Central on Wentworth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyguy61
Reviews.Content: An older hotel at the lower end of the cost spectrum at the edge of the Central Business District (CBD) in Sydney. Rooms range from old style (a box from the 70s with a window view of a brick wall and shared bath) to nicely done well equipped rooms in the three star hotel style (of course with en-suite bath). I stayed in one of those rooms for two nights before joined by a friend to share one of the twin deluxe rooms for four more nights and the basic room was ok and definitely a step up from a hostel. The location is within reasonable walking distance of Sydney's main downtown attractions and close to several rail transport stations for easily getting to Bondi Beach, King's Cross or other more distant areas. Staff was very friendly and helpful and with 24 hour reception. For those on a budget, it is a good value for the area and though the lower end rooms need paint, they are clean and ok and the shared baths roomy, lots of hot water and clean. A fan is provided, no A/C. The deluxe rooms are with A/C and are on a par with other area hotels but at substantially lower cost. WiFi is available in the rooms but was not very reliable or fast. If you have a laptop and are going to be in Sydney for a week or so, spend $20 for a 2GB USB dongle from Optus, it works great anywhere, even in a taxi. Free Internet is available on a hotel owned computer though it is often in use by others. The hotel is close to Chinatown and in an area with many good mid-range restaurants and the World Square Shopping Center that has a large grocery store, electronics and phone shops and many clothes shops. There is an elevator unlike many of the older area hotels so getting to the room with baggage is not so difficult. There is a communal kitchen though it is pretty rough. Do not lose your key, there is a $100 charge because they have to change the lock! There is no downstairs bar (as is the case for many lower cost older hotels in the area) so no noise. It is nice and quiet even on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all cots”
Reviews.Author: Greig99
Reviews.Content: This is the worst experience I have ever had, dirty tired rooms, and the service is nonexistent ad the front desk clerk is rude nd obnoxious, the most unhelpful person I have ever dealt it, I strongly recommend do not stay there, this hotel gives Sydney a bad reputation

Reviews.Title: “AVOID !!!”
Reviews.Author: Perko88
Reviews.Content: Without consideration this is a location to be avoided at all costs, sleep on a park bench and you will find friendly and happier people in the cold of the night than the staff employed at Sydney Central on Wentworth. Seriously a very tired and dirty place to put your head down coupled with rude and arrogant staff determined to make your stay unpleasant. Try Hyde park for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “The photos are deceiving...”
Reviews.Author: tommytompkins
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was the location. Everything else left me yearning for a simple clean room. The carpets felt wet, there was no heat, one light bulb high up made reading almost impossible, only 2 outlets in the room, the TV didn't work. and the wifi was slow and erratic...and expensive. And the lift has to be the slowest on the continent. No room service whatsoever...I'd never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: andrew_sunline
Reviews.Content: Everything was good. Room was clean and spacious. Wasn't exactly 5 star but I didn't expect that for the price anyway. It was also close to everything good in Sydney. Not much to eat nearby but very practical and convenient place to base your Sydney visit from.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been to..... BIG MISTAKE!”
Reviews.Author: Pollypocket01
Reviews.Content: Filthy hotel, dirty stained bed sheets with hairs in the bed. Had to sleep on towels. Not their towels as they were also ripped, well used and of terrible quality. When I explained that I wasn't happy with the standard of the room I was told "don't even go there, I know where our sheets are cleaned" the staff treated me with aybserloutly no respect. I couldn't wait to leave. On top of that the hotel stinks of smoke. It is vile!

Reviews.Title: “Please, for your own sake!!”
Reviews.Author: fernbar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, in a great location, fresh smelling with curtious, kind and mild mannered staff - IF YOU HAVE SPENT THE LAST SIX MONTHS IN A DETENTION CENTRE!!!! Stay away this hotel needs to be reviewed by Australian Hotels Association - surely this is not representative of first world county!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation,”
Reviews.Author: Ros67_11
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel better than I thought it would be, very basic, however that reflects in the price. the room itself although showing signs of age was clean, I found the guys at reception to be courteous and helpful, the kitchen although not very big certainly well equipped, toilet and shower area clean, the place was fairly quiet and I felt safe, There were various smells that could be attributed to the age of the building and maybe smokers somewhere close by but certainly not overpowering. it is within easy walking distance to city centre and would be happy to stay there again if on the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “This place will ruin your holiday!”
Reviews.Author: ABchoke
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed in this hotel; whilst we knew that we were looking for budget accommodation we had no idea what we had let ourselves in for! This is not a hotel, but a hostel. Â  A friend booked the hotel room for us online but failed to notice that there was an option for smoking and non-smoking rooms, we subsequently were placed in a smoking room. Even if the room was non-smoking, cigarette smoke from the smoking rooms lingers in the communal areas (besides this the rooms are poorly ventilated, windows are filthy, the sheets are dirty, the carpet stained and generally everything is dated). As my girlfriend is severely asthmatic we simply could not stay in the room so after 1 night (of the 3 we had booked and paid for) at 7:30 the next morning we asked management if we could get a refund. To be fair, the receptionist did offer a room with an en-suite which was a non-smoking room, but it was $40 which we were not willing to pay considering that smoke still lingers in the communal areasâ€¦..The manager was willing to refund one dayâ€™s money but not two; he suggested that we return and see the manageress. This was understandable; after all it is not his fault that the hotel is dirty, poorly run etc â€“ I appreciated how frustrating it must be pursuing a career in such a poor hotel. Â  Â  We returned to see the manageress who agreed with her duty manager regarding the refund; which again was understandable â€“ after all it is a business. I asked if we could meet in the middle and split the costs, which the manageress declined to do. What is not acceptable or understandable is the atrocious, aggressive, abusive, and ignorant customer service offered by the reception staff. At NO POINT was my girlfriend or I aggressive or abusive, however the receptionist saw if fit to scream at the top of his lungs for several minutes hurling abuse whilst we, in a very civil manner, tried to argue our point. I cannot stress enough how rude, aggressive and abusive the receptionist was and I assume still is. His reaction was totally disproportionate and under no circumstances should someone like this work in any industry that deals with the general public. The manageress was not able to handle the situation and seemed visibly shaken at the manner in which her receptionist was acting (but still never did anything about it). When we attempted to raise the point how unacceptable the behaviour of the receptionist was he called the police or at least pretended to do soâ€¦..great way to treat paying guests?!! Â  Please do not stay at this hotel; it will ruin your Australian experience. We found a room at the Metro with an en-suite for the same price with staff that actually value customers. Alternatively stay in a hostel where there are fun loving staff and not rude, bitter or resentful about their choice of careers or workplace.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Josey029
Reviews.Content: An absolute disgrace. Please take all the reviews seriously, this hotel will ruin your time in Sydney. Rude, disgusting behaviour from the staff especially Mark who works on the reception, he has NO customer service skills, NO people skills, he is aggressive, intimidating and grotty. Not the sort of person you would have representing a dust bin never mind a Central Sydney Hotel. Women travelling alone should stay clear. Actually anyone travelling to Sydney should stay clear. Revolting hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very budget and basic”
Reviews.Author: jfors999
Reviews.Content: OK so I booked a budget hotel, so no big surprise it wasn't anything fancy! However a few things you should be warned about as you may want to think about other options if any of these matter to you. 1. I was in an end room, 1A, that faced the Wentworth St intersection. It was SOOOO noisy all night and day. I shudder to think what it would be like at peak hour, but I was there on a weekend and it was simply unceasing. 2. the room was so stuffy and hot. No fan. Had to have windows open so that made the traffic noise worse. There were no screens and the inside light was a fluorescent so I had to watch the tv in the dark in case of mozzies and other yukkies. Luckily none came in this time, but i can see potential to be eaten alive by mozzies. 3. the windows led out onto a roof for the below floors that connected all surrounding rooms, so it was not safe (in my view) to leave the windows open when out, meaning the room stayed very stuffy while I was out all day. 4. this room was quite far from toilets and most toilets didn't have soap, but they do provide it in your rooms with the towel. 5. they don't provide cups/glasses!! OK am i going mad or is that really weird for a place that provides a communal kitchen and a fridge in the room?? I ended up taking a saucepan from the kitchen and filling that up with water so i could have a drink by my bed! On the plus, they have a deal going with the Wilson's parking nearby on Goulburn St for $20 per day (incl night) which could make a huge difference, esp being a CBD location. Personally i think you can get better options for a budget price, eg in Kings Cross that also include a bathroom in the room. Also i didn't find the staff particularly friendly or helpful but they weren't terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Hillmumma
Reviews.Content: Booked online and then was a bit apprehensive after I read some reviews. But this place was great! Clean and basic - but with everything you could want. You can walk to all the inner city tourist attractions and so easy to get a bus/train to everything else. We had a standard twin room with comfortable beds and it was even quiet! Had 3 different hotel staff serve me at reception and all were friendly and helpful. It's not 5 star (or even 3 star!), but it's great value for money - would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel price, real HOTEL service!”
Reviews.Author: Vivivivi_vi
Reviews.Content: We paid a discounted price to stay in one of the double room. and we get MUCH MORE than what we had paid for. GREAT LOCATION, the receptionist offered a GREAT SERVICE and keen to solve our problems. The room has everything a HOTEL ROOM should has (just in a simple manner) - fast wifi & computer, TV, towel& soap, kettle & mud, coffee & tea, fridge, wardore and a fan!! The building and furnitures are old but they managed to keep them VERY CLEAN!! =D Unfortunately, there a no kitchen, common area and heating ... but we can get cheap dinner at around $6.5 around Elizabeth street or in the Central station. And there are NO NOISY BACKPACKERS!!

Reviews.Title: “Avergage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wads1970
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine - nothing fancy, the rooms were fine, but I did find a cockroach in the shower. Could have done with a bigger TV. The only real moan I have is the lift, it was so slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: AliOz
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews about Sydney Cebtral on Wentworth on this site i was really surprised to find a great room with everything we needed- including a flatscreen TV, a new, bright, clean bathroom and overall one of the best value for money deals i have found in Sydney! I stayed in a Premium Ensuite Room which i undertand is newly built. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great place to stay that is close to some of Sydney's best hotspots. Probably not the type of place you would take a partner to impress them on a special night out- more somewhere you would go with friends and a place to crash if you are having a big night out.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: farnarklerCanberra
Reviews.Content: Ok this hotel isn't going to impress your wife/girlfriend/mistress/mother-in-law but for a cheap place which isn't too far from all the central sights, this hotel is ideal. The room is very simple but clean and thankfully didn't smell of smoke even though it was a smoking room. The room I was in just is across the corridor from the bathroom, which was nice. The other bathrooms on the third floor aren't quite so nice, being two floors above the kitchen of an Indian restaurant. I enjoy Indian food to eat but not when the smell of the food permeates a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms, broken furniture, very poor accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: guevera
Reviews.Content: If you were considering staying at the Sydney Central Private Hotel, think again. If you want budget accommodation, you shouldn't go this low. The rooms were dirty - stained carpet, mould on walls, graffiti on the windows, torn carpet - and the first thing you notice when you enter the room, is how bad it smells. There aren't any places to eat nearby, unless you want to buy 2-minute noodles or sandwiches from convenience stores. The only upside is the free internet - but it is slow, and has been known to play up. Otherwise, I would not recommend anyone stays here. It cost around $100 for one night for two people, but even if you are on a budget, you should think about spending more so you can stay somewhere clean, with better facilities, and get a room that doesn't smell terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Warning do not stay here, sfaff insulting and can not even be trusted.”
Reviews.Author: world_travel_NZ
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t write reviews that often as i'm dyslexic and find it a bit difficult, but I felt that I really wanted to write this review, as I experienced the worst service I have ever received not just in a â€œhotelâ€�, but in ANY service industry. Staff were very rude to the point of being really insulting (there were many examples of this). Staff could not even show courtesy in speaking and spoke in grunts. Every request made even for small things (like change for washing machine etc), was met with a reaction of â€œour asking for too much!â€�. Staff seemed to only be there to check keys, and make sure the hotels strict no visitorâ€™s policy was ahead too. I agree with other reviewers that the rooms were very basic, and not well looked after, but I was expecting this so it did not pose that much of a problem to me, (as I spent a lot of time out and about exploring Sydney). I was so disappointed with my stay there, that I decided to cut my trip short in Australia, and returned home with AU$1500, that I was going to spend on clothing, dinning out etc with business in Australia for the next few more days, so not only did the â€œHotelâ€� miss out on more of my money, but so did the local economy. Itâ€™s amazing how much NSW Tourism can spend on campaigns to encourage people to visit, then to have one hotel let them down so much. I felt really sorry for the tourist that traveled further than me, I bet they left with a horrible (and wrong) interpretation of what Aussies are like. I bet you they told there friends about there experience too. On the last day (22/02/08), I owed the hotel another night accommodation which was fine (for staying on 2 hours after checkout), so I paid this promptly to reception. They asked me if I wanted a receipt, I said no (I was in a rush), that was the first time they smiled in my whole stay. Iâ€™m 100% sure the staff just kept the money for themselves. I had a lot of bags and they did not even have to courtesy to call me a taxi, even after stealing off me. No wonder they had such a smirk on there faces when I checked out. The only pleasant service was from the very hard working housekeeping staff. This place is a real let down, and bought down my whole Australian experience. I think someone in the Tourism industry should no something about this place, or risk creating a negative view of Australia and Aussies in general.

Reviews.Title: “It was acceptable”
Reviews.Author: tusoo
Reviews.Content: I booked the standard room for three nights. I booked the hotel online before coming to this site and reading the reviews. So when i had finished booking and stumbled by this page and read all the horrible reviews, i was scared out of my pants! But when i arrived at the hotel, i didnt really know what was so bad! Sure, my room did have the smell of smoke inbedded into its flooring and walls, and the room didnt have a phone or a kettle, but it was perfectly acceptable. The shared bathroom facilities werent that bad. It was clean and that was all that mattered. The location was great as it is in the CBD and is a mere 5 minute walk to Central Station. It is also near a lot of convenience stores and restaurants so you would never have trouble finding a place to eat. One thing that did kind of annoy me was the traffic at night. At night, you can hear the police and ambulances ringing down the streets, the loud voices or drunkards and party goers. The noise doesnt quite dull down. But, the hotel was quite reasonable. A bit expensive for the quality, but nonetheless, average.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this hotel- worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Valeska26
Reviews.Content: My experience at Central Private Hotel (Sydney Central On Wentworth) was the worst experience I have ever had staying at a hotel in my life (and I've travelled a lot!). I booked the room for 2 nights on a website. I was intending on having my sister stay with me on the first night and my brother stay with me on the second night. There was no information on their website indicating that this would present any problem. When I arrived at the hotel, I asked if it would be possible for me to pay extra to have both my siblings stay in the room with me across the two nights. The hotel receptionist shook his head (no verbal communication). I then asked him if it was possible to pay for a bigger room to enable this to occur, and he again shook his head. It was a struggle getting him to actually speak to me. He referred to the "registered guests only" signs that were splayed throughout the reception area, and made me sign a form where I listed one person as the registered guest (so I listed my sister). On the second night, I went to take my brother up to my room to stay with me. The male receptionist yelled out at me "Registered Guests Only". I explained that my sister was the guest the previous night, and that my brother was the guest staying with me tonight. He said I could not do this, sarcastically adding that "its not musical rooms" and that it was "TOO BAD",When I calmly told him that I found his service to be quite rude, he replied by saying "THAT'S LIFE". I was so offended by the rudeness that the staff had shown me since my arrival that I did not wish to stay anymore. When I told the receptionist I wished to check out due to the rudeness I had experienced by the staff, his response was "WHATEVER". I asked him to explain his rudeness to me given the usual customer service principles followed by hotels. He did not respond. I said that I could not see the problem in having my brother as my guest the second night and that there was no information on the website that changing your registered guest for the second night was not possible, otherwise I would not have booked. Their response was "We can't put everything on the website". I explained that i had come down to tell my siblings that I was pregnant and to stay a night each with them. I showed them my brother's i.d. to prove he was my brother. My brother asked if we could check out and then check in again with him named as the registered guest and they said that it would cost me another $89 to do this. The hotel staff also told me that "YOUR PROBLEM IS YOU JUST DON'T LISTEN". I checked out, again letting them know it was due to their rude treatment as I did not feel comfortable staying at the hotel. The next day I rang the manager.. She said that she "could not see the issue" when I described the rudeness shown to me by her hotel staff. She also said that she thought that I was just annoyed because I didn't get my own way with the room situation and so I was causing a fuss! I explained that my issue was the rudeness of her staff. She said that the staff had written in their logbook that I "harassed" them for an hour. I explained that I was in fact only there for 20 minutes maximum, and could prove this by the call logs on my mobile phone. I also spoke respectfully to her staff despite their treatment towards me. She said "Why would I trust you when I don't know you. I've known these men for 20 years so I trust them over you". It made no difference when I said that my brother and sister were there as witnesses. She refused to provide me with a refund, and even suggested that maybe i was just being over-emotional due to being pregnant!!!! I have never been made to feel so unwelcome staying in a hotel in my life- they had no understanding of customer service principles, in fact, it seemed they felt that they were the ones doing a favour to me by letting me stay at the hotel (forgetting that I was in fact a paying customer!). The allure of this hotel is its cheap price, but I have stayed at cheaper hotels around the world with far greater customer service.

HotelInfo.Name: Sydney Central on Wentworth
HotelInfo.Address: 75 Wentworth Avenue, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
